page.title: 11LIFE STYLES
page.content: The hairdresser in Grant Street is William's.William and six ladies work here,some part time.Every week about 150 people come to have their hair done while they chat or listen to pop music. Ladies mostly have a cut and style or a perm.There are special rates for Old Age Pensioners.Often they style hair specially to suit a bride's or a bridesmaid's headdress.Little girls come for a shampoo,style and blow dry. It is good to have nice sleek hair that falls into shape after you shake your head.Susan can dye or bleach people's hair.Men go to William's too. They might have long or short hair cut or beards trimmed and styled. Teenagers have quite different styles. They have their hair standing out in spikes or shaved to look like a Mohican.Only some though.
